1.text: Wisdom hath builded her house, She hath hewn out her pillars—seven.

2.text: She hath slaughtered her slaughter, She hath mingled her wine, Yea, she hath arranged her table.

3.text: She hath sent forth her damsels, She crieth on the tops of the high places of the city:

4.text: Who is simple? let him turn aside hither.’ Whoso lacketh heart: she hath said to him,

5.text: ‘Come, eat of my bread, And drink of the wine I have mingled.

6.text: Forsake ye, the simple, and live, And be happy in the way of understanding.

7.text: The instructor of a scorner Is receiving for it—shame, And a reprover of the wicked—his blemish.

8.text: Reprove not a scorner, lest he hate thee, Give reproof to the wise, and he loveth thee.

9.text: Give to the wise, and he is wiser still, Make known to the righteous, And he increaseth learning.

10.text: The commencement of wisdom is the fear of Jehovah, And a knowledge of the Holy Ones is understanding.

11.text: For by me do thy days multiply, And added to thee are years of life.

12.text: If thou hast been wise, thou hast been wise for thyself, And thou hast scorned—thyself bearest it.

13.text: A foolish woman is noisy, Simple, and hath not known what.

14.text: And she hath sat at the opening of her house, On a throne—the high places of the city,

15.text: To call to those passing by the way, Who are going straight on their paths.

16.text: Who is simple? let him turn aside hither.’ And whoso lacketh heart—she said to him,

17.text: ‘Stolen waters are sweet, And hidden bread is pleasant.’

18.text: And he hath not known that Rephaim are there, In deep places of Sheol her invited ones!
